questions.question: Which of the following is the correct syntax for adding the header file in the C++ program?

You can read input that consists of multiple lines of text using:
answers: the cin.get( ) function with one argument
the cin.get( ) function with two arguments
the cin.get( ) function with three arguments
questions.answer: the cin.get( ) function with two arguments

questions.question: The keyword friend does not appear in:
answers: the class allowing access to another class
the class desiring access to another class
the private section of a class
the public section of a class
questions.answer: the private section of a class

questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct about the formal parameters in C++?
answers: Parameters with which functions are called
Parameters which are used in the definition of the function
Variables other than passed parameters in a function
Variables that are never used in the function
questions.answer: Parameters with which functions are called

questions.question: An exception is caused by:
answers: a problem in the operating system

questions.question: If a member needs to have a unique value for all the objects of that same class, declare the member as
Which one is not a correct variable type in C++?
If you wanted to sort many large objects or structures, it would be most efficient to
answers: place them in an array & sort the array
place pointers to them in an array & sort the array
place them in a linked list and sort the linked list
place references to them in an array and sorts the array
questions.answer: place them in a linked list and sort the linked list

It becomes an inline function of the class
questions.answer: It becomes an inline function of the class

questions.question: What is an inline function?
answers: A function that is expanded at each call during execution
A function that is called during compile time
A function that is not checked for syntax errors
A function that is not checked for semantic analysis
questions.answer: A function that is expanded at each call during execution

questions.question: An inline function is expanded during
When are the default values of a function defined?
answers: When the scope of the function is over

questions.question: Where should default parameters appear in a function prototype?
answers: To the rightmost side of the parameter list
To the leftmost side of the parameter list
questions.answer: To the rightmost side of the parameter list

questions.question: If an argument from the parameter list of a function is defined constant then
answers: It can be modified inside the function
It cannot be modified inside the function
questions.answer: It cannot be modified inside the function

questions.question: Which of the following refers to characteristics of an array?
answers: An array is a set of similar data items
An array is a set of distinct data items
An array can hold different types of datatypes
questions.answer: An array is a set of similar data items

questions.question: If we stored five elements or data items in an array, what will be the index of the last data item?
Which of the following is the correct syntax for declaring the array?
Which of the following is the correct syntax for printing the first element?
Which of the following gives the 4th element of the array?
Which type of memory is used by an Array in C++ programming language?
What is an array of the one-dimensional arrays called?
What is the correct definition of an array?
answers: An array is a series of elements of the same type in contiguous memory locations
An array is a series of element
An array is a series of elements of the same type placed in non-contiguous memory locations
An array is an element of the different type
questions.answer: An array is a series of elements of the same type in contiguous memory locations

questions.question: Which of the following gives the memory address of the first element in an array?

answers: Both can return a different value
questions.answer: Both can return a different value

questions.question: How many parameters can a resize method take?
Which of the following is correct about remove_extent() function?
answers: Removes the given dimension from an array
Removes the first dimension from the right of the array
Removes the first dimension from the left of the array
Removes the last dimension from the left of the array
questions.answer: Removes the first dimension from the left of the array

questions.question: Which of the header file is used for array type manipulation?
What is the use of is_array() function in C++?
answers: To check if a variable is array type or not
To check if a variable is 1-D array type or not
To check if a variable is 2-D array type or not
To check if a variable is 1-D or 2-D array type or not
questions.answer: To check if a variable is array type or not

questions.question: What is the use of is_same() function in C++?
answers: To check if a variable is array type or not
To check whether two variables have the same characteristics
To check if two variable is of array type or not
To check whether two variables are different or not
questions.answer: To check whether two variables have the same characteristics

questions.question: What is the use of rank() function in C++?
answers: Returns how many total elements can be stored in an array
Returns how many elements are in array currently
Returns the dimension of an array
questions.answer: Returns the dimension of an array

questions.question: Which of the following is correct about extent() function?
answers: Returns how many elements are in array currently
Returns the size of the 1st dimension
Returns how many total elements can be stored in an array
Returns the size of a given dimension
questions.answer: Returns the size of a given dimension

questions.question: Which of the following is correct about remove_all_extents() function?
answers: Removes the all dimension from an array
Removes the first dimension from the left of the array
Removes the last dimension from the left of the array
Removes the first dimension from the right of the array
questions.answer: Removes the all dimension from an array
